questions.question_text:
An administrator has an existing vRealize Operations instance that monitors an existing vSphere infrastructure. The company has just deployed NSX-T across all hosts managed within this vSphere infrastructure.
The administrator has been asked to configure vRealize Operations to monitor the new NSX-T installation.
Which action should the administrator take to accomplish this goal?

choices.D: Add NSX-T account under Other Accounts.
choices.A: Add NSX-T account under Cloud Accounts.
choices.C: Configure NSX-T monitoring under the Cloud Account of the existing vCenter Server of the vSphere infrastructure.

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: B
I think it's B. Data Sources -> Integrations -> Add Account

Selected Answer: A
A for me as per :
https://docs.vmware.com/en/VMware-Cloud-Foundation/services/vcf-intelligent-operations-management-v1/GUID-A9EA9F71-4735-4C2B-8692-423559979F9C.html

questions.question_text: What should be defined to ensure that group members can access vRealize Operations objects when importing a group from Active Directory into vRealize Operations?

discussion.content: For me its B role, you should assigne role to the group.

choices.C: Assign different costs per GB to each of the storage types discovered by vRealize Operations.
choices.A: Use a vSphere tag category, assign different tag values for that category to the different tiers in the vSphere client, and then assign different costs per GB for each tag value.
choices.B: Create a custom group in vRealize Operations for each of the storage tiers, and then assign a cost per GB to each custom group.
choices.D: Use a vRealize Operations tag with different tag values manually configured for each datastore or datastore cluster object on the Inventory page, and then assign a cost per GB for each tag value.

questions.question_text:
An administrator has been tasked with configuring vRealize Operations cost drivers to assign a different cost per GB for different storage tiers.
Which steps should the administrator complete to meet this objective?

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: A
The cost engine in vRealize Operations allows setting storage base rates (cost per GB per month) using vSphere Tags. Custom groups based on the same vSphere Tags can be leveraged to provide better insight into storage cost and utilization

The cost engine in vRealize Operations allows setting storage base rates (cost per GB per month) using vSphere Tags. Custom groups based on the same vSphere Tags can be leveraged to provide better insight into storage cost and utilization
Correct answer, B - You cannot save it

questions.question_text:
An administrator has been using the troubleshooting workbench feature to identify an issue with a virtual machine and configured the specified time range and scope in the active session.
When returning to the troubleshooting workbench the following day, the administrator can see the Virtual Machine context as a recent search. Upon opening this object, though, the changes made the previous day are no longer visible.
What is the cause of this issue?

choices.A: The product needs to be licensed with vRealize Operations Enterprise edition.
choices.B: Changes made to scope, time, or potential evidence are not saved after logging out.
choices.C: The administrator did not click the Save option when using the troubleshooting workbench.
choices.D: The vRealize Operations instance has been restored from an earlier backup.

discussion.content: For me D you should have it in policy
